context_bundle.summary: NIC hardware offload features that reduce CPU load. Checksum offload: NIC calculates TCP/IP checksums. LSO (Large Send Offload): OS sends large chunks, NIC segments into packets. RSS: Distributes receive processing across CPU cores (Ethernet only, not Wi-Fi).

onboarding.quick_start:
CHECK CHECKSUM: Get-NetAdapterChecksumOffload -Name 'Wi-Fi 3'
CHECK LSO: Get-NetAdapterLso -Name 'Wi-Fi 3'
CHECK RSS: Get-NetAdapterRss -Name 'Ethernet' (Wi-Fi doesn't support RSS)
CHECK ALL ADVANCED: Get-NetAdapterAdvancedProperty -Name 'Wi-Fi 3'
common_patterns: Checksum offload: RxTxEnabled for IPv4/IPv6 TCP/UDP
LSO v2: Max offload 64KB, both IPv4 and IPv6
RSS: Multi-queue for Ethernet NICs only
Leave offloads enabled for best performance

known_errors.prevention: Check offload settings after driver update

lso.benefit: Reduces CPU overhead for large transfers
